column1: 3335B403-50CB-4D09-B0CE-A170A0894EDB#appfire#BEC197BD-AB9A-4279-9E49-8A34499DC5AF#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-15 11:28:14.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-15 11:28:14.0#appfire#1

34309CF9-5256-4A3E-BC93-2141AA949E5E#appfire#BEC197BD-AB9A-4279-9E49-8A34499DC5AF#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-15 11:28:14.0#appfire#null#appfire#2016-01-15 11:28:14.0#appfire#1
